choices: time to find you and your sister a user
you go find your own user without your sister
your a hybrid and use your sister
111.content:
You are a 15 year old boy named Blaine
who was brown hair, blue eyes nice sweet faced boy, but dont let him fool you the reason he was admitted at such a early age is that he can become a wepion of such
mass destruction can level a entire city if used properly.

he is quiet timed despite his power, a very nice kid, but deep down he has a burning desire for world domination along with this he dosent let anyone knoe that he believes that life can overcome death.

oh and as a weapon for duel weapon or shield users he is a one handed long sword that, for single weapon users extends into a bladed whip or a grate sword.

lastly he has a twin sister that turns into a shield they are mainly used together by the same user but Sarah has her own page.
111.title: Blaine Cleveland

1111.content: so a existing or new person in the academy?
1111.title: time to find you and your sister a user

11112.content:
Now this is where you build a meister to use Blaine and Sarah.
keep in mind that you chose Blaine as the main caracter.

(a message to the author please remember to edit the the names of the choices to mach the name of the new caracters more people will read the ones that people have made. one more thing Dia please edit this part thats in this mark "( )" instead of deleting this chapter please!)
11112.title: Enter:The new meister

1112.content:
You leave your sister behind... thats cold man... but you like to be able to use your secondary weapon forms like the two handed sword or bladed whip.

Anyway whos your meister?
1112.title: you go find your own user without your sister

choices: you find go someone with Blaine
you leave Blaine behind and get your own meister
112.content:
Sarah is a 15 year old girl yes I said 15, she is a Nice girl with long flowing brown hair up in a ponytail but she leaves some in the front, icey blue eyes, her boobs are c-cups but she is overall balanced, she is 135 LBs.
she is a nice soft spoken yet all-or-nothing girl.

The weapon she turns into is a shield (if you can call it a weapon).
She is usually used at the same time as her brother Blaine Cleveland (one handed long sword) as a pair, but if her brother is not around she has spikes going out the rim and center of her.

So your first day has arived time to find a meister.
112.title: Sarah Cleveland

1121.content: A existing or new student?
1121.title: you find go someone with Blaine

1122.content:
So you were tired of playing sidekick to Blaine, he was disappointed but he respects your choice.

Even though you hurt him you know he will be fine on his own.

Ok so a new or existing meister?
1122.title: you leave Blaine behind and get your own meister

113.content:
Alexander Meuser
age 15
weapon form: Saber.

Alexander is of average height and has messy brown hair and brown eyes. He possesses a web of thin scars across his face from a childhood incident in which he was nearly killed by a Kishin Egg. The first opinion most people form about Alexander is that he's a punk. Usually angry and not shy about voicing his displeasure with people or situations loudly and with as much profanity as possible. He's something of a problem student at DWMA in the sense that his antisocial tendencies make it difficult for him to develop a functional relationship with a meister. In spite of his attitude Alexander sincerely wants to succeed as a weapon and protect people.

how does this story start?
113.title: Create character

choices: A training exercise with her partner (readers choice on the partner).
114.content:
Claire Tetsuoni
Page 17
Keapon form: Kanbo (a type of knobbed iron club)

Claire is a sweet girl with curly blonde hair she normally wears pigtails. She has green eyes and his little on the short side. She's a bit chubby something which is partially a side effect of her cooking as a hobby.

How does her story start?
114.title: Create character

121.content:
"So.....what in the world is this place again?"

This was Greg Thomas' first time in Death City. Frankly, it hadn't been long since he just arrived here. Who would have thought that there was a such a place in the middle of nowhere? And by nowhere, I mean Nevada.

Before this, Greg was just an average guy, 15 years old and living with his parents and sister. He had short strawberry-blonde hair and blue eyes, with an average height and size. Frankly, he wasn't used to the supernatural, but he apparently had the "gift" for it. Well, that's what the creepy guy who visited his house said anyway. Greg still wasn't sure about it.

Still, here he was, clad in a blue shirt and tan shorts and normal shoes for a guy. You could see the DWMA from practically anywhere, so he pretty much assumed that was where he was supposed to go. Maybe someone would then tell him where he's supposed to stay. The guy had never been on his own before. He still didn't know how his parents got convinced enough to let him come.

Well, standing around wasn't going to help, so Greg began walking up at his own pace. Supposedly, assuming this academy had semesters at all, things were starting up soon. Greg kind of wondered if he'd get to meet anyone. He didn't have many friends before, though he had a respectable bunch back at home. Supposedly, he heard something about getting a "partner" or something weird like that. Perhaps he should have actually read the manual to this place.
121.title: A New Story

1212.content:
As Greg walked through toward the academy he heard a voice. "Oi! You there!" A 16-year old girl with short white hair and wearing a white hoodie open in front with a black tank top underneath and beige pants. She had a fairly slim yet built frame. Her accent seemed a bit normal but had a British sound to it. The girl carried a blue duffle bag over her shoulder as she approached the boy. "You know where the academy is?"

Greg was taken back a bit and just motioned to the giant structure. "That's it? Oh, I'm a bloody idiot. Sorry." She claimed.

Greg replied, "It's no problem. I'm trying to get there too."

The girl grinned in surprise. "Really? Well we should go together then," she extended a hand. "My name's Naomi Lanister. Nice meetin' ya." She smiled greatly.

She grew up on the streets of her town. No family or friends. So when someone offered her a place to stay she immediately accepted it. She was ready to carve a new path for her life.

What happens next?
1212.title: Other Choice

12121.content:
"Um, sure. The name's Greg. Greg Thomas," Greg said while hesitantly shaking her hand. What was someone like her doing all the way out here? Apparently, she was about as clueless as he was.

"Oh nice." said Naomi. "So where are you from?"

"Colorado. So quite a ways from here." Greg explained.

"Oh nice." she replied. Greg raised an eyebrow at how positive she seemed to be, but he shrugged it off. This was perhaps the closest he had been to a girl in a while. Not too often that ran up to him.

"You know, not to be rude, but your name doesn't sound....well natural. No offense." spoke Greg, much to Naomi laughing a little bit.

"Nah, a lot of people say I have a weird name. I'm used to it." Naomi just shrugged off. Greg decided to end that topic right there.

"So what are you doing here?" asked Greg.

"I was to come here to this academy. Don't really know why. Didn't read the book." said Naomi.

"Neither did I." said Greg. Boy, they were just a couple of teens without a clue. What were they to do? Well, they still saw quite a few people their own age heading towards the academy. Guess they had to now. Perhaps someone would explain this whole mess of a situation.
12121.title: The two enter the academy

121211.content:
Naomi seemed to already act like friends with the boy she just met. She smiled as they entered the academy. A man stood there holding a list in his hands. Naomi and Greg waited in the line. "What do you think this is for?" Naomi asked Greg, who only replied with a shrug.

Soon the two approached and were asked for their names. After giving them the man replied, "Welcome, Meister Greg. So you already met your weapon huh?"

Naomi walked forward and leaned toward the man, both hands on her hips. "What's this weapon talk about?"

The man just handed the two manuals and books. "Lord Death has authorized you two your own home within the city," he said giving a pair of keys to the two. "You can rest there once the day is done. Head down the hall to your first lesson."

Naomi and Greg soon began walking as Naomi leaned over, "Guess we're partners huh?"

What next?
121211.title: First experience

choices: Settle in at their new residence
1212111.content:
The duo soon entered an outside training grounds. A few other groups in pairs of twos stood there waiting for instructions. Naomi leaned to you again shrugging her shoulders. "I'm wondering why I am assigned to work with you when you have a title," she said, referring to win her clothesen the man called him a Meister. "Also, how are we suppose to fight?"

Another instructor entered the courtyard and began shouting out to have the Meister's partner assume weapon form. This caught Naomi by surprise. "Assume...weapon form?" The instructor noticed the two and approached with a watch and a ring. He gave the ring to Naomi and the watch to Greg.

"Here," the man said plainly, "this will help you two if you are having trouble."

Naomi slid the white ring onto her finger and Greg soon placed the watch on his wrist. At that moment, Naomi felt a form of energy surround her and focus on her body before she was caught it a white flash for a few seconds. She heard Greg let out a noise of surprise as she opened her eyes. She felt...naked, for lack of a better word. "What happened?" She said. In the reflection of the window she caught a glimpse of herself. Well, she wasn't there. Just Greg and his weapon...

She soon saw the main blade of the spear and ace like weapon have a curved eye shape to it with a moving pupil in the center. Hers. "The bloody hell is this? Greg?"

"Y-you're a weapon," Greg said, finally piecing it together. "I'm the wielder, or 'Meister'. You're meant to be my partner. The weapon."

Naomi didn't fully understand, but decided if this was her role, she'd try it out. "Alrighty...I'll try to be as Pike-like as possible." They underwent standard motions, all of which seemed natural to them before they returned to normal. Naomi was just glad she reappeared in her clothes. That was all they were taught then. They were allowed to either return to their residence to settle in or wander the academy.

What does Greg and Naomi decide to do?
1212111.title: Training

12121111.content:
"What in the world was that all about?" Greg groaned as he scratched his head a bit.

"To be honest, I'm not totally sure," Naomi replied. "So, this academy is for "meisters" and "weapons" apparently? I never knew that."

"What's more surprising is that the weapons are people if that class was anything. I expect a full explanation soon." Greg groaned, making Naomi giggle a bit.

"No argument there," Naomi said. By now, they were heading back towards the city, trying to find the residence on a note they both had. "It's kind of funny though. Did that ring made me change...or have I always had that?"

"I can't say. Maybe it's in your family?" suggested Greg.

"No, I'm pretty sure it's not. I'm sure I would have noticed if there were." Naomi said quickly, shooting down Greg's idea.

"Well, I guess the heavy duty stuff isn't until tomorrow. Figured as much, as it's already late. I had a small lunch just to make it here." Greg sighed. Why did all of this just have to pop up out of nowhere?

"Funny, my trip was similar. How about we go out for some supper once we see where we live?" suggested Naomi.

"Fair enough." Still, finding their residence was easier said than done. Unfortunately, Naomi had NO sense of direction, often making Greg wonder how she even found Death City. Seriously, she went into the same dead end THREE TIMES!

"That's it. Give me the map!" Greg grabbed it away from her, making Naomi pout as she put her hands on her hips. Greg's luck wasn't much better, but at least he was able to get some directions, leading them to an apartment complex where they saw a lot of students walking around. Not bothering to talk, they just walked right in, going up a few floors.

"Told you I could find it." Greg smirked.

"Shut up."

Still smirking, Greg eventually found their room on the fourth floor, not bad since he actually liked being higher up. The place was like a condo, with a kitchen and some rooms and such. They immediately say down their luggage.

"Well, not bad at all," smiled Greg.

"I get to call first room!" volunteered Naomi.

"And why is that?" asked Greg.

"Because a lady needs her space."

"And your point?"

Naomi huffed and just walked into a room, making Greg smirk. This girl was way too easy to unsettle.
12121111.title: Settle in at their new residence

121211111.content:
After that, the duo got to setting their personal items in. Thankfully, there were actually two bathrooms, so they wouldn't have to fight over a shower. Greg still found it kind of odd that he was now sharing this apartment with this girl, but apparently he had no choice now. Thankfully, the place was well stocked, especially in the kitchen where it had all the appliances necessary.

"This is great. I've have you know that I'm a pretty good cook," smiled Naomi.

"That's nice, though perhaps we should go out tonight. You know, explore the place a bit more," suggested Greg.

"Okay, that's good too," said Naomi.

Greg had a good amount of cash on him, and his bank account wasn't too bad either. Hopefully they even accepted credit cards out in the desert. Anyway, with that in mind, the two of them left, walking around for a bit in hopes of getting to know the place better. Still, Greg had to do the directing, because Naomi kept running into dead ends.

"How did you find this place again?" Greg smirked, earning him a light slap on his elbow. "By the way, where exactly did you come from? I can tell by the accent that you're not naturally from America."

Naomi gently smiled. "Well, I'm actually half-American and half-British, but you're right that I didn't come from here. I was born in London, and I lived there most of my life. I came here directly from there actually. I'm trying to fit in though."

"Don't worry too much. I'd say you sound fine the way you are," spoke Greg. "So, um, do you even have money?"

"I think I know how you use it here, and I got a lot of money exchanged when I entered the country," thought Naomi.

"Ah good, guess that saves me from having to explain it," smiled Greg, with earned one from Naomi too. After a time, they actually found a place called Death Cafe. If this was any other city, that would probably freak people out. Not this one apparently. Inside, it appeared as a typical kind of late-night restaurant, appealing to both families and individuals. Greg ordered a table for two, and the many featured many typical foods.

"So Naomi..." started Greg.

"Yes?"

"When you..um...changed into that spear, what was it like?

"Well....hmmm, kind of hard to say. I felt like I was myself, yet not myself. I felt strong though, more than I ever had before," said Naomi.

"Same for me. I wonder what it's all really about," pondered Greg. Then, Naomi smiled again.

"Well, that's for another day. I've been dying to try these American burgers!"

Greg could do nothing but chuckle.
121211111.title: Dinner Time

1212111111.content:
Naomi woke up slowly and stretched. She groaned and looked at the clock. She was never used to waking up so early. She slipped on her regular clothes and walked out of her room to see Greg ready to go and awake?" He asked with a bit of a smirk.

She groaned and put her hand to her head. "As a awake as I can be in the morning."

The two soon went off to the academy. They realized that they were both in the same class. When it came to finding the classmi just about circled through the halls twice before Greg stepped in to find the class.

The two were soon in seats next to one another in the class. The class was a bit...weird. It started off with the teacher talking about a man long ago who devoured human souls. He was driven insane and became something called the Kishin. Luckily however, Lord Death was able contain the Kishin and locked him away within the academy. To stop this from ever happening, they looked for people who could become weapons and meisters to use them to help stop those who may try to become a Kishin.

Also, a goal for the weapons would be to consume the souls of those who try to become Kishins. Specifically, 99 Kishin souls and the soul of one witch. Completing so would allow you to be used by Lord Death.

Soon the two were given time to try and do what they did yesterday in the courtyard but without the accessories that caused it. They were taught about 'Soul Resonance' lining up their Souls' wavelengths in order to function greater. After a few shaky tries, the two managed to achieve their previous form with Naomi again as a Pike. "Yeah, finally got it!" Naomi couldn't help but laugh. However weird her new role was, she was finally discovering how to use it. Today seemed to just be learning about Soul Resonance.

What happens next?
1212111111.title: First Day of School

12121111111.content:
"Well, I guess that class kind of worked," said Greg as they entered their residence.

"What do you mean? We were really in sync there," smiled Naomi, handing up her jacket.

"I'm not sure if that was what the teacher was talking about. All we really did was work on you getting into weapon form easier. Besides, that teacher said something about wavelengths and the fact that we were really off,"

"Well, that's not too surprising. I didn't even know you before yesterday," said Naomi.

"That's true. I get the feeling that this is really going to take a while....great, I honestly don't have the patience for this," sighed Greg. Who knew how much training it was going to take for them to get in sync. To their credit, many other students didn't do well either, but a lot of them seemed to at least knew their partner well. The only thing Greg and Naomi knew about each other was where they were from.

"Anyway, enough depressing thoughts, I'm hungry!" Naomi clapped her hands together.

"Great, do you know how to cook?" Greg said plainly.

"I'm fairly good. I had to teach myself a bit before coming to his country. Nothing too special though. What about you?" Naomi asked.

"Um, you don't want to taste my cooking. Trust me, I tried once," said Greg. "I'm pretty bad."

"Really? I don't think it would be too hard if you knew the recipe," pondered Naomi.

"Well, it's always one thing or another. Sometimes, I turn the stove on too high, or not cook the meat enough, or whatever. The list goes on and on." Greg said. Naomi tilted her head slightly to the side, but didn't object. The decision was made then for her to cook dinner. Greg figured that they would need the energy. Starting tomorrow, there would be more classes. After all, in addition to meister and weapon duties, they apparently still needed to learn typical school topics, like math and science. Greg paled at the thought of it. Guess there was no avoiding that.

"Hey Greg, if you aren't going to do anything else, then at least pass me the condiments!"

"Yes mother," Greg groaned.
12121111111.title: That night

121211111112.content:
Naomi finished her dinner and sat down and began reading a book she had found on the shelf. She read for a little while before Greg took a seat on the chair nearby. "What you reading?" Greg asked.

Naomi sighed, "It's a book I found talking about the city." She then set it down and looked over to you. "I'm still reeling a bit from all this. Me literally becoming a weapon, meeting you, a meister. I'm wondering how all this will turn out." She sighed.

Greg spoke up a moment later. "I've been thinking the same thing for awhile. But I think we'll be fine. We just have to watch each others' back. I think we just need to give it some time."

Naomi replied, "Really? Yeah, okay. Thanks Greg." She got up to head to her room but stopped and turned back. "O-oh, um, you think you could help me in a class...and...finding the class?" She reddened a bit embarrassed.

Greg smirked a bit, "Don't worry."

Naomi smiled, "Thanks." As she headed off to bed.

A month passed, the two learned how to fight and began learning about the town and making friends. It wasn't long before they were sent after those who are trying to become Kishins. It was a bit unnerving for both of them the first time Naomi had to 'eat' a soul. They began learning about witches and the Kishin himself. Naomi and Greg continued to watch out for each other, Greg making sure Naomi doesn't get lost while Naomi cooks edible food for when they don't go out for food.

What now?
121211111112.title: During the night

1212111111121.content:
"Hey, Naomi," Greg said as the two were walking home from their classes. She turned smiled. "What is it?" She said.

"Did you hear? There's been weird sightings around the city and people can't find out what it is. The academy wants us to keep an eye out for anything." Naomi nodded to Greg's reply. "Alright, but I don't think it can be too serious, and if it is, we can fight it off right?"

She walked through the street and they were about two blocks from their home when night came. "That's odd. It's only 6 P.M." Naomi said. Greg answered back, "This might be what the academy is talking about. Maybe we should-"

Before she could finish, Naomi and Greg heard a bloodcurdling cackle. The duo turned and looked up toward the figure on the roof. She wore a dark robe with odd designs and a hood and some kind of talisman around her neck. "It's lovely, isn't it?" She said looking up to the sky.

"Can we help you?" Greg said a bit surprised. The woman turned back with a beaming, unnerving smile. She then jumped down by them. "Yes, you can die and be a clear message to your academy." She said and threw out her hand, from the shadows casted came black tendrils that lunged toward them.

The two were fast enough to dodge the tendrils. "Naomi!" Greg yelled. "On it!" She jumped back to Greg and began resonance turning into a Pike. The woman laughed, "Oh, that's cute." She pointed at them with her palm up and bent her finger. Shadows cast by a building behind them launched tendrils as well. Greg jumped out of the way and began to take a few jabs at the woman with Naomi. She focused on her but seemed unable to hit her.

The woman yawned. "I'm getting bored." She waved her hand and caused a wall to form behind them and to their immediate sides. Leaving them open to the front for attack. The woman launched again another volley of tendrils, but now they had no where to run. "Greg!"

Naomi dropped out of her form and took the blow, the tendrils pierced her through the chest, arms, thighs while one sliced at her face across her eye. Greg took no damage from it from Naomi shielding him. Naomi looked back with her injured eye. "Greg...you...?" She soon fell onto her chest.

The woman groaned. "That sucks. I wanted to kill both of you at once. Oh well, maybe next time," she grinned and then simply disappeared, leaving Greg with Naomi.
1212111111121.title: After class...

12121111111211.content:
"Naomi!" Greg ran right over, kneeling down over his bloodied teammate. Naomi was barely conscious, with wounds across her chest and limbs. However, while Greg could see that her vitals had likely not been hit, the biggest concern was Naomi's face. The attack went vertical across Naomi's left eye, practically slicing through it. He gently turned her over to get a better look, hoping that she hadn't bled out already. To his surprise, she was still awake, a small smile on her face.

"What the hell are you smiling about?!" Greg nearly yelled.

"Heh...I'm not....too sure....Did I...screw up?" She was clearly attempting to humor him, but her voice had no effort behind it. Greg certainly wasn't in the mood for that nonsense.

"You moron...." Greg spoke quietly.

"Is everyone alright?!" Greg immediately turned to see a small group headed their way. It was one of their teachers, leading a small group of meisters. It was Mr. Tristin Homs, one of many teachers at the academy. The man had short brown hair, wearing a suit that would almost make you think he was a part of the military. Thankfully, he didn't act like one. Fittingly, he was a Gunner Meister. However, one look at the scene gave the man all he needed to know. "Call the medical team immediately! Tell them we have a student down!"

"Yes sir!" Two of the crew members complied and called back to the academy. Meanwhile, Tristin walked over to the fallen Naomi, who was still conscious but pretty much numb by this point.

"What do you think, sir?" asked Greg with worry.

"From what I can tell, her vitals are still intact. We just have to make sure she doesn't bleed out," replied the teacher. He glanced over the wounds, observing how they were formed. "Did whoever do this use shadow tendrils on any kind?"

"Y-Yes, that's right!" confirmed Greg. "Wait, how did you know that?"

"We had been getting reports of a "Shadow Witch" around the area. Nothing too special, just your usual witch with a grudge. Still, she's obviously more than a match for a rookie meister," spoke Mr. Homs. The last remark didn't sit well with Greg, though it was true. The last month did well for him and Naomi, but they were still far from polished. Of their missions, they had collected 8 Kishin eggs, but they were all small-time villains. Half the time, they couldn't even get Naomi's weapon form to work right.

"This sucks...couldn't do a damn thing...." Greg mumbled in anger, both for that witch and his weakness.

"Don't beat yourself up for it. You're simply not ready. That's what the academy is for," said the teacher as he continued to stabilize Naomi. Eventually, a medical corps arrived, taking Naomi in. Greg knew that there would be no sleep for him tonight, so he insisted that he come along.
12121111111211.title: Aftermath

121211111112111.content:
Naomi slowly opened her eye, as her other was covered by bandages and a cloth patch. She felt numb still but could barely move herself. She groaned as she squinted her eyes from light through a window. She wore a simple white patients' garb and laid in one of the beds in a vacant medical room.

Almost vacant.

She looked to her left to see a wooden chair and to see Greg asleep in it, slumped. She smiled lightly as she saw Greg begin to awaken. "You...shouldn't sleep like that...you'll hurt your back or somethin'...." she said as he turned and leaned in closer, repositioning himself in the chair.

"Naomi! How...how do you feel?" Greg asked his partner.

"Well, I'm more experiencing a lack of feeling, I feel numb," she smiled, but that disappeared as she reached toward her eye. "Have they....you know?" She asked.

Greg took a deep breath. "It was cut open, so they could only remove it."

They were silent for a short time. Greg was about to apologize to her before Naomi let out a faint noise, "I'm an idiot..." She felt her eye water up. "I must've worried you so much I...just wanted to protect you. Now look at me," she choked the last part out.

"Moron." She looked to Greg who had just spoken up. "I should be apologizing. I wasn't strong enough to stop that witch...and you took it upon yourself to protect me?" Greg held onto one of her hands. "Thanks..."

Naomi let herself smile through watering eyes. "Thank you." She tighten her grip on his hand.

"Hey..."

"Yeah?"

"Am I keeping you from anything...?"

"No, don't worry."

"Good. I wasn't gonna let you leave my side until I can stand up anyway...Thanks..." Naomi smiled to him. She knew they'd have to work harder.

What happens next?
121211111112111.title: Medical News

1212111111121112.content:
Fortunately, the injuries to Naomi's legs weren't too bad, and she was cleared to leave eventually that day. Her left eye was still bandaged, which she just left that way. However, while her chest injuries had healed a bit, she was told to not transform or do anything strenuous for a while. She accepted that grudgingly.

Anyway, Greg at least helped her home, as if Naomi would make it there otherwise. They got some sympathetic looks on the way back, to which Greg was thankful for. Still, it brought his mind back to the event. They were nowhere near that witch's power. Who knows how long it would take for them to reach it.

"Greg, are you alright?" Naomi asked with a curious look.

"Y-Yeah, I'm fine. Just thinking." said Greg.

"Really? If you need to talk, I can..."

"Don't bring it up," Greg snapped back, not wanting to talk about it anymore. Rather than look offended, Naomi just let the topic slide for now. They eventually got back to the apartment, though it was getting late. It was about time for dinner. One of Naomi's arms was still too injured for her to use, which left them with either going out or Greg cooking. Truth be told, Greg didn't want to cook. They got a good pay for the times they had to go out in search of evil humans, but he didn't want to spend it all. Well, perhaps it was just time to bite the bullet and give it a try.

"I'll try and whip up something," Greg said.

"Really? You're going to cook?" Naomi asked with a surprised look. Greg had refused to cook over the last month, so she never really got to see why he beat himself up over it so much. Well anyway, Greg sat her down on the sofa so she could watch TV while he gave it a go. To be honest, this was the girl who saved his life. He really wanted to nail this.

With that, Greg ended up making some spaghetti, though he ended up putting in too much tomato sauce and paste. He probably got them mixed up again. In all honesty though, it was passable, according to Naomi anyway.

"Compared to how gloomy you were on it, I think you can improve," she smiled.

"Well, that's more positive than my parents put it," said Greg.

"Hey, if you can improve on cooking, then that means I can learn to read directions,"

"Good luck on that,"

The two of them shared a nice laugh after that, nice to think about the positive things after all, though guilt still continued to linger in Greg's mind.
1212111111121112.title: She recovers

info.description: Just create your own DWMA student you can be a weapon or a meister, but NO ONE GETS TO BE ANYONE THAT EXISTS IN THE SHOW, but you can be friends with people in the show
